definition: A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens 查爾斯·狄更斯|查尔斯·狄更斯[Cha2 er3 si1 · Di2 geng1 si1]
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Tripoli today is a tale of two cities.
sentences.chinese: 的黎波里今天上演雙城記。

sentences.english: He’d accepted that, and he’d read for a while.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了這一事實，並讀了一會《雙城記》。

sentences.english: Dickens' "A Tale of Two Cities" is a literary classic.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的《雙城記》是一部古典文學作品。

sentences.english: Dickens'; A Tale of Two Cities is a literary classic.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的《雙城記》是一部文學名著。

sentences.english: Where can I find A Tale of Two Cities by Dickens?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪兒可以找到狄更斯的《雙城記》？

sentences.english: Tale of Two Cities is my favorite English classic.
sentences.chinese: 《雙城記》是我最喜愛的英國文學名著。

sentences.english: The first English novel that I read was A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens.
sentences.chinese: 我讀的第一本英代小說是狄更斯的《雙城記》。

sentences.english: I don't know how many of you have read Tale of Two Cities.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你們中多少人讀過雙城記。

definition: Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
Orwell (name)/George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984 一九八四年
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
